summary: Isildur is a character from J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy world, Middle-earth. He is an important figure in the history of the fictional kingdoms Arnor and Gondor. Isildur's father, Elendil, escaped the destruction of their home, the island of NÃºmenor, and became king of these new realms. Isildur is known for cutting off Sauron's powerful Ring, but he failed to destroy it, becoming corrupted by its power. His death led to the Ring's journey to Bilbo Baggins, as told in "The Hobbit." Isildur's story is featured in Peter Jackson's "The Lord of the Rings" movies and other adaptations.
title: Isildur
